title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0125

segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: Welcome to another lesson at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到EnglishPod的另一节课。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: So, Marco, what are we talking about today?
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，今天我们要谈什么？

segments.en: Today we're going to be talking about a popular topic all over the world, and that is smoking.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈一个全球热门的话题，那就是吸烟。

segments.en: Well, not so popular in the States right now, to be honest.
segments.cn: 嗯，老实说，在美国现在并不那么流行。

segments.en: Well, that's the thing.
segments.cn: 嗯，这就是问题所在。

segments.en: In every country in the world, now they are becoming more strict on smoking and where you can smoke, so it's becoming very difficult for smokers nowadays.
segments.cn: 在世界上的每个国家，现在对吸烟和吸烟的地方变得越来越严格，所以现在吸烟者变得非常困难。

segments.en: Well, it's a good reason to want to quit.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是想戒烟的一个好理由。

segments.en: And that's what we're going to be talking about today, is quitting smoking.
segments.cn: 而我们今天要谈的就是戒烟。

segments.en: Well, before we get going, we do have a really important phrase that we should preview in today's vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 嗯，在我们开始之前，我们确实有一个非常重要的短语，应该在今天的词汇预览中预览一下。

segments.en: All right, so on vocabulary preview, we're going to take a look at this word, pack of smokes.
segments.cn: 好吧，在词汇预览中，我们要看看这个词，烟包。

segments.en: Pack of smokes, so... A pack of smokes.
segments.cn: 烟包，所以……烟包。

segments.en: So, smokes is a word for cigarettes.
segments.cn: 所以，烟是香烟的意思。

segments.en: It's the same thing.
segments.cn: 是同样的东西。

segments.en: Smokes or cigarettes.
segments.cn: 烟或香烟。

segments.en: Right, but a pack is, you know, like 20 cigarettes.
segments.cn: 对，但一包是，您知道的，大约20支香烟。

segments.en: It's a box of cigarettes.
segments.cn: 这是一个香烟盒。

segments.en: You buy them in a pack.
segments.cn: 你是以包的形式购买它们。

segments.en: You don't just buy one at a time.
segments.cn: 你不会一次只买一支。

segments.en: So, again, the phrase is pack of smokes.
segments.cn: 所以，再次强调，这个短语是烟包。

segments.en: Pack of smokes.
segments.cn: 烟包。

segments.en: So, why don't we listen to our dialogue for the first time and see what's going on with this smoker.
segments.cn: 那么，我们为什么不第一次听听我们的对话，看看这个吸烟者发生了什么。

segments.en: Ah, it smells like an ashtray in here.
segments.cn: 啊，这里闻起来像烟灰缸。

segments.en: Hi, honey.
segments.cn: 嗨，亲爱的。

segments.en: What's wrong?
segments.cn: 怎么了？

segments.en: Why do you have that look on your face?
segments.cn: 你为什么有那种表情？

segments.en: What's wrong?
segments.cn: 怎么了？

segments.en: I thought we agreed you were going to quit smoking.
segments.cn: 我以为我们达成了你要戒烟的共识。

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不。

segments.en: I said I was going to cut down, which is very different.
segments.cn: 我说我会减少，这很不同。

segments.en: You can't just expect me to go cold Turkey overnight.
segments.cn: 你不能指望我一夜之间就彻底戒掉。

segments.en: Look, there are other ways to quit.
segments.cn: 听着，还有其他戒烟的方法。

segments.en: You can try the nicotine patch or nicotine chewing gum.
segments.cn: 你可以尝试尼古丁贴片或尼古丁口香糖。

segments.en: We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month, and now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place.
segments.cn: 我们每个月在香烟上花费一大笔钱，现在法律也在收紧，不允许在任何公共场所吸烟。

segments.en: It's not like you can just light up like before.
segments.cn: 现在可不是像以前那样随便点烟。

segments.en: I know, I know.
segments.cn: 我知道，我知道。

segments.en: I really am trying, but I don't have the will power to just quit.
segments.cn: 我真的在努力，但我没有意志力去戒掉。

segments.en: I can't fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch.
segments.cn: 我无法抵抗早上喝咖啡或午餐后想拿烟包的冲动。

segments.en: Please understand.
segments.cn: 请理解。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I want a divorce.
segments.cn: 我想离婚。

segments.en: Sorry, I just smoked a pack of cigarettes.
segments.cn: 对不起，我刚抽了一包香烟。

segments.en: You do smoke, don't you?
segments.cn: 你确实抽烟，对吧？

segments.en: Well, we'll talk about that later.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们稍后再谈这个。

segments.en: Alright, so it is a little bit extreme, though.
segments.cn: 好吧，这有点极端。

segments.en: I mean, he's divorcing her because she won't quit.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，他因为她不戒烟而和她离婚。

segments.en: Well, some people really are health conscious and are afraid of the negative side of smoking, which has a lot of health side effects.
segments.cn: 嗯，有些人确实很注重健康，害怕吸烟的负面影响，这有很多健康副作用。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Well, as he was complaining about all the negative effects and the negative aspects of smoking, he did mention, both of them mentioned a lot of great words and phrases, so why don't we take a look at them now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 嗯，当他抱怨吸烟的所有负面影响和负面方面时，他们提到了很多很好的单词和短语，所以我们为什么不现在在语言收获中看看它们。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: Well, this first word is a word that's very important for any smoker who goes to a bar or restaurant and needs to put the ash somewhere, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个词是对任何去酒吧或餐厅的吸烟者非常重要的词，需要把烟灰放在某个地方，对吧？

segments.en: So when you smoke, there's some ash, there's some messy, dirty stuff, and you need an ashtray to collect it.
segments.cn: 所以当你吸烟时，会有一些烟灰，有一些脏东西，你需要一个烟灰缸来收集它。

segments.en: An ashtray.
segments.cn: 一个烟灰缸。

segments.en: So an ashtray is something that's usually round or square, and you put it on a table, and it's just very helpful to keep the house clean or restaurant clean.
segments.cn: 所以烟灰缸通常是圆形或方形的，你把它放在桌子上，它非常有助于保持房子或餐厅的清洁。

segments.en: So if you're in a restaurant, you say, hey, can I have an ashtray, please?
segments.cn: 所以如果你在餐厅，你可以说，嘿，可以给我一个烟灰缸吗？

segments.en: So the residue or the stuff that, when you're smoking, it comes out the gray, I don't know, like dust, it's called ash.
segments.cn: 所以当你吸烟时，出来的灰色东西，我不知道，像灰尘的东西，叫做烟灰。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And this is a tray.
segments.cn: 这是一个托盘。

segments.en: But the complaint here is, oh, it smells like an ashtray in here.
segments.cn: 但这里的抱怨是，哦，这里闻起来像烟灰缸。

segments.en: That means it smells really, really bad in here.
segments.cn: 这意味着这里闻起来真的很糟糕。

segments.en: Yeah, it smells like cigarettes.
segments.cn: 是的，闻起来像香烟。

segments.en: Yeah, so that word again is ashtray.
segments.cn: 是的，所以那个词再次是烟灰缸。

segments.en: Ashtray.
segments.cn: 烟灰缸。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Well, and the guy was complaining, and he said, well, I thought you were going to quit smoking, and she said, no, no, I said I was going to cut down.
segments.cn: 嗯，那个人在抱怨，他说，我以为你要戒烟，她说，不，不，我说我会减少。

segments.en: She says it's very different from quitting smoking.
segments.cn: 她说这与戒烟是非常不同的。

segments.en: So Marco, maybe we should talk about how cutting down and quitting are different.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，也许我们应该谈谈减少和戒烟的不同。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So if I say I'm going to cut down on smoking, it's just I'm going to smoke less.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说我要减少吸烟，那就是我会少抽烟。

segments.en: Okay, so let's take an example.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们举个例子。

segments.en: I smoke 10 cigarettes a day, but I want to cut down.
segments.cn: 我每天抽10支香烟，但我想减少。

segments.en: How many should I smoke later?
segments.cn: 我以后应该抽多少？

segments.en: Maybe... Like two or three.
segments.cn: 也许……两三支。

segments.en: Two or three.
segments.cn: 两三支。

segments.en: Instead of quitting, so if you quit smoking, that would mean zero.
segments.cn: 而不是戒烟，所以如果你戒烟，那就意味着零。

segments.en: Zero cigarettes.
segments.cn: 零支香烟。

segments.en: No smoking anymore.
segments.cn: 不再吸烟。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So you can also cut down on carbs, like carbohydrates.
segments.cn: 所以你也可以减少碳水化合物，比如碳水化合物。

segments.en: So some people who cut down on carbs eat less bread.
segments.cn: 所以一些减少碳水化合物的人吃更少的面包。

segments.en: They don't eat any pasta.
segments.cn: 他们不吃任何意大利面。

segments.en: So these are really good ways of trying to talk about dieting as well as smoking.
segments.cn: 所以这些都是谈论饮食以及吸烟的好方法。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And I think we have a couple of examples of other ways we can use this phrase cut down.
segments.cn: 我认为我们有几个例子，说明我们可以使用这个短语减少。

segments.en: So let's listen to them now.
segments.cn: 所以让我们现在听听它们。

segments.en: You should really cut down on the amount of salt you eat.
segments.cn: 你真的应该减少你吃的盐的量。

segments.en: It's not good for you.
segments.cn: 这对你不好。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 示例三。

segments.en: My doctor told me I need to cut down on fatty foods because of my heart condition.
segments.cn: 我的医生告诉我，我需要减少脂肪食物，因为我的心脏病。

segments.en: And when you want to smoke a cigarette, you have to do something first with some fires.
segments.cn: 当你想抽烟时，你必须先做一些点火的事情。

segments.en: We call this lighting up.
segments.cn: 我们称之为点燃。

segments.en: To light up.
segments.cn: 点燃。

segments.en: So lighting up, it doesn't mean turning on the light.
segments.cn: 所以点燃并不意味着打开灯。

segments.en: It actually means using a lighter or some fire to start your cigarette.
segments.cn: 它实际上是指使用打火机或某种火来点燃你的香烟。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So you want to light up with the lighter matches or some sort of fire.
segments.cn: 所以你想用打火机、火柴或某种火来点燃。

segments.en: The man says, the husband says, it's not like you can just light up like before.
segments.cn: 这个男人说，丈夫说，现在可不是像以前那样随便点烟。

segments.en: That means it's not like you can just smoke like before.
segments.cn: 这意味着你不能像以前那样抽烟。

segments.en: So in some cases, light up means to smoke a cigarette.
segments.cn: 所以在某些情况下，点燃意味着抽香烟。

segments.en: We're in a movie theater and someone lights a cigarette.
segments.cn: 我们在电影院，有人点燃香烟。

segments.en: And I say, oh, you can't light up in here.
segments.cn: 我说，哦，你不能在这里点燃。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So you can't smoke in here.
segments.cn: 所以你不能在这里抽烟。

segments.en: You can't smoke in here.
segments.cn: 你不能在这里抽烟。

segments.en: It's another way of saying smoking.
segments.cn: 这是一种说抽烟的方式。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And she was explaining, you know, how difficult it is and she's trying to quit.
segments.cn: 她在解释，你知道，这有多困难，她正在努力戒烟。

segments.en: But she said, I don't have the willpower to just quit.
segments.cn: 但她说，我没有毅力去戒烟。

segments.en: Ooh, willpower.
segments.cn: 哦，毅力。

segments.en: So this is an important word.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个重要的词。

segments.en: Willpower.
segments.cn: 毅力。

segments.en: Willpower.
segments.cn: 毅力。

segments.en: You think of the main part of this word is will.
segments.cn: 你认为这个词的主要部分是意志。

segments.en: That means the desire to do something.
segments.cn: 这意味着做某事的愿望。

segments.en: You want to do something.
segments.cn: 你想做某事。

segments.en: So if I have willpower, I have strong willpower, what am I saying?
segments.cn: 所以如果我有毅力，我有强大的毅力，我在说什么？

segments.en: You're saying that you can make a decision and you can follow your decision.
segments.cn: 你在说你可以做出决定并遵循你的决定。

segments.en: So I decide not to eat cake.
segments.cn: 所以我决定不吃蛋糕。

segments.en: I have very strong willpower, so I never eat cake.
segments.cn: 我有很强的毅力，所以我从不吃蛋糕。

segments.en: If I don't have strong willpower, maybe I sometimes secretly eat cake in the middle of the night from my refrigerator.
segments.cn: 如果我没有强大的毅力，也许我有时会在半夜偷偷从冰箱里吃蛋糕。

segments.en: So that happens, right?
segments.cn: 所以这种情况会发生，对吧？

segments.en: Sometimes you don't have strong enough willpower, so you kind of eat a little bit of cake when nobody's watching.
segments.cn: 有时你没有足够的毅力，所以当没有人看时，你会偷偷吃一点蛋糕。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And you can have willpower about lots of different things.
segments.cn: 你可以在很多不同的事情上有毅力。

segments.en: So this is a great word, again, to use when you're talking about dieting or smoking or drinking.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个很好的词，再次用于谈论节食、抽烟或饮酒。

segments.en: Any type of maybe temptation.
segments.cn: 任何类型的诱惑。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And well, she said she had this urge to reach for her pack of smokes.
segments.cn: 她说她有冲动去拿她的香烟。

segments.en: Ooh, urge is another good one.
segments.cn: 哦，冲动是另一个好词。

segments.en: It's very similar to willpower, but an urge is kind of like a physical feeling that makes you want to do something.
segments.cn: 它与毅力非常相似，但冲动有点像一种身体感觉，让你想做某事。

segments.en: So you have like this strong desire.
segments.cn: 所以你有这种强烈的愿望。

segments.en: So I have the urge to go swimming today.
segments.cn: 所以我今天有游泳的冲动。

segments.en: I don't know why, but I really want to.
segments.cn: 我不知道为什么，但我真的想去。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: You have an urge.
segments.cn: 你有冲动。

segments.en: Interesting word.
segments.cn: 有趣的词。

segments.en: Pregnant women often have these kinds of things too.
segments.cn: 孕妇通常也会有这些感觉。

segments.en: I have the urge to do something.
segments.cn: 我有做某事的冲动。

segments.en: We also call them cravings.
segments.cn: 我们也称之为渴望。

segments.en: Oh, cravings or urge to do something.
segments.cn: 哦，渴望或做某事的冲动。

segments.en: All right, interesting.
segments.cn: 好吧，有趣。

segments.en: So we've taken a look at these five great words, and I think we should listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了这五个很好的词，我认为我们应该再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: We're going to slow it down just a little bit, and then we'll come back and talk some more.
segments.cn: 我们会稍微放慢速度，然后再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Oh, it smells like an ashtray in here.
segments.cn: 哦，这里闻起来像烟灰缸。

segments.en: Hi, honey.
segments.cn: 嗨，亲爱的。

segments.en: What's wrong?
segments.cn: 怎么了？

segments.en: Why do you have that look on your face?
segments.cn: 你为什么有那种表情？

segments.en: What's wrong?
segments.cn: 怎么了？

segments.en: I thought we agreed that you were going to quit smoking.
segments.cn: 我以为我们达成了共识，你要戒烟。

segments.en: No, I said I was going to cut down, which is very different.
segments.cn: 不，我说我会减少，这很不同。

segments.en: You can't just expect me to go cold Turkey overnight.
segments.cn: 你不能指望我一夜之间就彻底戒掉。

segments.en: Look, there are other ways to quit.
segments.cn: 听着，还有其他戒烟的方法。

segments.en: You can try the nicotine patch or nicotine chewing gum.
segments.cn: 你可以试试尼古丁贴片或尼古丁口香糖。

segments.en: We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month, and now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place.
segments.cn: 我们每个月在香烟上花费一大笔钱，现在法律也在收紧，不允许在任何公共场所吸烟。

segments.en: It's not like you can just light up like before.
segments.cn: 你不能像以前那样点燃。

segments.en: I know, I know.
segments.cn: 我知道，我知道。

segments.en: I really am trying, but I don't have the willpower to just quit.
segments.cn: 我真的在努力，但我没有毅力去戒烟。

segments.en: I can't fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch.
segments.cn: 我无法抵抗早上喝咖啡或午餐后想拿香烟的冲动。

segments.en: Please understand.
segments.cn: 请理解。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I want a divorce.
segments.cn: 我想离婚。

segments.en: And we are back, so we have a great part of our show where we like to talk about some phrases that help you attain fluency.
segments.cn: 我们回来了，所以我们有一个很好的节目部分，我们喜欢谈论一些帮助你提高流利度的短语。

segments.en: That means sounding like a native speaker of English, and today's phrases are wonderful.
segments.cn: 这意味着听起来像一个英语母语者，今天的短语很棒。

segments.en: Alright, so let's take a look at them now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们现在在流利度构建器中看看它们。

segments.en: Fluency Builder So on Fluency Builder today, let's take a look at two different phrases, and let's start with the first one.
segments.cn: 流利度构建器 今天在流利度构建器中，让我们看看两个不同的短语，先从第一个开始。

segments.en: She mentioned something about going cold Turkey overnight.
segments.cn: 她提到了一些关于一夜之间彻底戒烟的事情。

segments.en: What is that phrase, cold Turkey?
segments.cn: 这个短语，彻底戒烟是什么意思？

segments.en: Now this is a very strange phrase, okay?
segments.cn: 这是一个非常奇怪的短语，好吗？

segments.en: So first of all, why would a Turkey be cold?
segments.cn: 首先，为什么火鸡会是冷的？

segments.en: They have lots of feathers.
segments.cn: 它们有很多羽毛。

segments.en: And second of all, what does it have to do with cigarettes?
segments.cn: 其次，这与香烟有什么关系？

segments.en: Right, so if I say I'm going cold Turkey, what is that?
segments.cn: 对，所以如果我说我要彻底戒烟，那是什么？

segments.en: So just take this as a phrase.
segments.cn: 所以把这当作一个短语。

segments.en: Don't think about the actual words, because they won't make sense in this context.
segments.cn: 不要考虑实际的词，因为在这个上下文中它们没有意义。

segments.en: What we're talking about is quitting smoking entirely.
segments.cn: 我们谈论的是完全戒烟。

segments.en: You're not going to cut down.
segments.cn: 你不会减少。

segments.en: That means today, I'm not going to smoke at all, and I'm never going to smoke again.
segments.cn: 这意味着今天我不会抽烟，而且我再也不会抽烟。

segments.en: That means never ever will I smoke another cigarette.
segments.cn: 这意味着我永远不会再抽另一根香烟。

segments.en: So it's cold Turkey.
segments.cn: 所以就是彻底戒烟。

segments.en: So if I go cold Turkey, it means I stop doing something immediately, and suddenly, and forever.
segments.cn: 所以如果我彻底戒烟，意味着我立即、突然、永远停止做某事。

segments.en: Entirely.
segments.cn: 完全。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So you can use this phrase for different habits, different things that you do, like drinking, for example, or cutting down on sugar.
segments.cn: 所以你可以把这个短语用于不同的习惯，做的不同事情，比如饮酒，或者减少糖的摄入。

segments.en: But generally, we just say this about cigarettes.
segments.cn: 但通常我们只是说这与香烟有关。

segments.en: So it's mostly related to smoking.
segments.cn: 所以它主要与吸烟有关。

segments.en: Yeah, so... Going cold Turkey.
segments.cn: 是的，所以……彻底戒烟。

segments.en: Some people like to smoke less, like one cigarette a day or one cigarette a week, but going cold Turkey is supposed to be the hardest.
segments.cn: 有些人喜欢少抽烟，比如每天一根或每周一根，但彻底戒烟被认为是最难的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Okay, going cold Turkey.
segments.cn: 好吧，彻底戒烟。

segments.en: Alright, and well, he was explaining the different negative aspects of smoking.
segments.cn: 好吧，他在解释吸烟的不同负面影响。

segments.en: He said, well, you know, they spend a fortune on cigarettes every month, and he said laws are cracking down.
segments.cn: 他说，你知道，他们每个月在香烟上花费一大笔钱，他说法律正在收紧。

segments.en: So if the laws are cracking down, what is he trying to say there?
segments.cn: 如果法律在收紧，他想说什么呢？

segments.en: Well, this is actually a very interesting point because in America right now, it's very hard to smoke in public places.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的观点，因为在美国，现在在公共场所吸烟非常困难。

segments.en: So this means that the government is trying to stop people from smoking.
segments.cn: 这意味着政府正在试图阻止人们吸烟。

segments.en: So they say, no more smoking in public places, no more smoking in restaurants, no more smoking in bars.
segments.cn: 他们说，公共场所不再允许吸烟，餐馆不再允许吸烟，酒吧不再允许吸烟。

segments.en: And so this means they're cracking down.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们在收紧管制。

segments.en: They're making it harder to do something.
segments.cn: 他们让某些事情变得更难。

segments.en: So they are becoming more strict.
segments.cn: 所以他们变得更加严格。

segments.en: I think for this phrase, we should listen to a couple of more examples just to make sure we understand it.
segments.cn: 我认为对于这个短语，我们应该再听几个例子，以确保我们理解。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 例子一。

segments.en: The police are cracking down on drunk driving in our city.
segments.cn: 警方正在我们城市打击酒后驾驶。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 例子二。

segments.en: Our school has really started to crack down on tardiness.
segments.cn: 我们学校真的开始严格控制迟到。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 例子三。

segments.en: The president has passed a law that will crack down on possession of illegal substances.
segments.cn: 总统通过了一项法律，将打击非法物质的持有。

segments.en: Alright, so the government is cracking down.
segments.cn: 好的，所以政府在收紧。

segments.en: Laws are cracking down.
segments.cn: 法律在收紧。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: So this is an important one because you read this in the newspapers as well about certain laws and police action.
segments.cn: 这是一个重要的点，因为你在报纸上也会看到关于某些法律和警方行动的报道。

segments.en: Alright, great.
segments.cn: 好的，很好。

segments.en: So I think it's time for us to listen to this dialogue for one last time.
segments.cn: 我认为是时候让我们最后一次听这个对话了。

segments.en: And then we'll come back and talk a little bit more about this vice.
segments.cn: 然后我们再回来谈谈这个恶习。

segments.en: Look, there are other ways to quit.
segments.cn: 看，有其他戒烟的方法。

segments.en: You can try the nicotine patch or nicotine chewing gum.
segments.cn: 你可以尝试尼古丁贴片或尼古丁口香糖。

segments.en: We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month.
segments.cn: 我们每个月在香烟上花费一大笔钱。

segments.en: And now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place.
segments.cn: 现在法律在收紧，不允许在任何公共场所吸烟。

segments.en: It's not like you can just light up like before.
segments.cn: 现在可不是像以前那样随便点烟。

segments.en: I know, I know.
segments.cn: 我知道，我知道。

segments.en: I really am trying, but I don't have the will power to just quit.
segments.cn: 我真的在努力，但我没有意志力去戒掉。

segments.en: I can't fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch.
segments.cn: 我无法抵抗早上喝咖啡或午餐后想抽烟的冲动。

segments.en: Please understand.
segments.cn: 请理解。

segments.en: Fine.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: I want a divorce.
segments.cn: 我想离婚。

segments.en: So do you have a problem with this vice as you call it?
segments.cn: 那你对这个你所说的恶习有问题吗？

segments.en: Are you a smoker?
segments.cn: 你是吸烟者吗？

segments.en: I'm really not.
segments.cn: 我真的不是。

segments.en: I'm the type of person that could maybe smoke socially.
segments.cn: 我是那种可能会社交性吸烟的人。

segments.en: Like if we go out to a bar with drinks.
segments.cn: 比如我们去酒吧喝酒的时候。

segments.en: A social smoker like they call it, right?
segments.cn: 就像他们所说的社交吸烟者，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I'm jealous.
segments.cn: 我很嫉妒。

segments.en: But not really.
segments.cn: 但其实并不是。

segments.en: You're a habitual smoker, right?
segments.cn: 你是习惯性吸烟者，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: Well, I was.
segments.cn: 嗯，我曾经是。

segments.en: I'm trying to cut down.
segments.cn: 我正在努力减少。

segments.en: So as a habitual smoker, I often smoked every day.
segments.cn: 作为一个习惯性吸烟者，我通常每天都会抽烟。

segments.en: Sometimes I smoked a lot and sometimes I smoked less.
segments.cn: 有时我抽得很多，有时抽得少。

segments.en: But right now I'm in a period where I'm mostly quit.
segments.cn: 但现在我正处于一个大部分戒烟的阶段。

segments.en: Okay, almost.
segments.cn: 好吧，差不多。

segments.en: Yeah, well I haven't smoked in a while and when I do it's just one cigarette.
segments.cn: 是的，嗯，我已经有一段时间没抽烟了，偶尔抽一根。

segments.en: Now it is interesting because like we mentioned laws are cracking down on where you can smoke.
segments.cn: 现在有趣的是，正如我们提到的，法律正在收紧吸烟的地方。

segments.en: But also taxes and cigarettes are becoming much more expensive, right?
segments.cn: 但香烟的税收也在上涨，变得更加昂贵，对吧？

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: Especially where I'm from in Chicago, it's easy to spend maybe 10 US dollars or 12 US dollars on one pack of cigarettes.
segments.cn: 特别是在我来自的芝加哥，可能花10美元或12美元买一包香烟。

segments.en: On a pack of cigarettes.
segments.cn: 一包香烟。

segments.en: Imagine that.
segments.cn: 想象一下。

segments.en: And you have people that can't help smoking one or two packs a day.
segments.cn: 还有一些人每天抽一到两包烟。

segments.en: So how much is that a month?
segments.cn: 那一个月要花多少钱？

segments.en: It's just an amazing amount of money.
segments.cn: 这真是个惊人的数目。

segments.en: Thousands of dollars.
segments.cn: 成千上万的美元。

segments.en: And I have to say though, a lot of my friends who used to smoke in America have quit.
segments.cn: 不过我得说，我在美国的很多朋友已经戒烟了。

segments.en: So this is maybe working.
segments.cn: 所以这可能是有效的。

segments.en: The whole thing of making cigarettes more expensive.
segments.cn: 让香烟变得更贵的整个事情。

segments.en: Yeah, making them much more expensive.
segments.cn: 是的，让它们变得更贵。

segments.en: Now another interesting thing and what I was reading recently is that you know those warnings that come on cigarette packs.
segments.cn: 现在还有一个有趣的事情，我最近读到的是，你知道那些香烟包装上的警告。

segments.en: That say smoking kills, smoking causes cancer.
segments.cn: 说吸烟致死，吸烟导致癌症。

segments.en: Actually a study has proven that it's not effective.
segments.cn: 其实一项研究证明这并没有效果。

segments.en: That people don't mind it or even worry about the cautions on the cigarette packages.
segments.cn: 人们并不在意，甚至不担心香烟包装上的警告。

segments.en: Well as a smoker I could say that generally if you're going to smoke a cigarette don't look at the label that much.
segments.cn: 作为一个吸烟者，我可以说，通常如果你要抽烟，不要太在意标签。

segments.en: You just throw it in your bag and you forget about it.
segments.cn: 你只是把它放进包里，然后忘记它。

segments.en: But it's actually gotten to the point where people choose the cigarette pack based on the picture.
segments.cn: 但实际上，人们选择香烟包装是根据图片。

segments.en: So it's like oh yeah, give me the one with the black lungs or give me that one.
segments.cn: 所以就像，哦，是的，给我那个有黑肺的，或者给我那个。

segments.en: Oh God.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪。

segments.en: Yeah, it's interesting.
segments.cn: 是的，这很有趣。

segments.en: So it's not really working.
segments.cn: 所以这并没有真正起作用。

segments.en: I guess we're going to have to find other ways to make people more conscious about this vice.
segments.cn: 我想我们需要找到其他方法让人们更加意识到这个恶习。

segments.en: We should.
segments.cn: 我们应该。

segments.en: But come to our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 但请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Tell us what you think about this vice smoking.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你对这个吸烟恶习的看法。

segments.en: Is it good?
segments.cn: 这是好还是坏？

segments.en: Is it bad?
segments.cn: 你是习惯性吸烟者还是只是社交吸烟者？

segments.en: Are you a habitual smoker or just a social smoker?
segments.cn: 是的，我们的网站上还有很多很棒的东西，工具供你使用。

segments.en: Yeah, we also have lots of great stuff, tools for you on our website.
segments.cn: 还有扩展句子和所有帮助你在车上或家外继续学习的东西。

segments.en: So check it out.
segments.cn: 所以请查看一下。

segments.en: Let us know what you think.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你的想法。

segments.en: And until next time.
segments.cn: 下次见。

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you there.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们到时见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
